msContents.summary: Part of the signatures to a loan of money (cancelled), with acknowledgment of repayment to the lender and docket of the bank of Pamphilius stating PERILELUTAI (H DIAGRAFEI. One of the parties was a member of the Althean deme. Repayment dated in the twenty-second year of Tiberius Caesar Augustus, Choiach (Grenfell & Hunt).

msItem.note: Text is on one side only, 19 lines written with the fibers. Four or more hands are represented: lines 1-10, 11-12(?), 13-16a, 16b-17(?), and 18-19 (in the lower margin).

supportDesc.support: 12.2 x 18.3cm. Five conjoined vertical strips of a roll, with remnants of 19 lines written along the fibers and large lacunae; lower margin preserved (including a two line note written in it). The top 12 lines (with a blank space large enough for two lines between 10 and 11) have been marked for deletion with large diagonal X lines.

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1896-7) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1901, Dr. Parrish Collection).

listBibl.bibl: P. Oxy. 2.323 SB 10.10234 John R. Abercrombie, ìThe University Museumís Collection of Papyri and Related Materials,î Expedition 20.2 (Winter 1978): 32-37.
